cleaned_text: Vaccines can prevent outbreaks of disease and save lives. When a high proportion of a community is immunized against an infectious disease, the risk of infection for susceptible individuals within that community is reduced. They are protected against that disease because there is little opportunity for an outbreak. Immunizations are required by law for children who attend public and private schools, preschools, childcare facilities and Head Start programs in Oregon. Some employers or professions require them as well. Our staff can help you determine which immunizations you or your child may need. Immunization Services for Children - Dtap - Flu - Hepatitis A - Hepatitis B - Hib - HPV9 - Meningococcal (MCV4P) - MMR - Rotavirus - Td - Tdap - Varicella Immunization Services for Adults [COVID-19*](https://nunmhealthcenters.com/covid19/) - Flu - Hepatitis A, B and A/B combo - Hib series (special conditions apply) - MMR (For college students) - Pneumococcal Conjugate (PCV13) (PPV23) - Td - Tdap - Varicella (special conditions apply) Payment We accept payment by cash, check and credit card. Our healthcare services are covered by many insurance programs, as well as Oregon Health Plan (OHP). Ask if we are contracted with your insurance provider when you call to schedule your appointment. Payment is due at the time of service. We are a Vaccines for Children federally funded partner, and some patients qualify for free immunizations. Please ask about this program if you are uninsured
